inclusion.criterion: Two or more recurrences of C. difficile infection (CDI) with recurrence defined as a positive test result, e.g. Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) test and with appropriate symptoms within 2-8 weeks of last positive result, provided that symptoms from earlier episode resolved with or without therapy.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Failed standard therapy with oral metronidazole and/or oral vancomycin
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: One or more episodes of severe CDI resulting in hospitalization and not responding to standard antibiotic therapy. Hospitalization for CDI occurs in the setting of severe diarrhea, abdominal pain and signs of systemic toxicity
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: patients with acute severe colonic dilation at risk for colonic perforation
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient is a 60-year-old woman admitted to the stroke department with a recent history of a second course of intravenous antibiotics for aspiration pneumonia. She is febrile and complained of abdominal pain and diarrhea (bowel movements eight times in 3 hours, large volumes of greenish, liquid stool each time).
